page.title: 04Ancient Monuments Page 2
page.content: CHESSMEN: also found in Abbey House excavations were whalebone chessmen,the oldest found in England now in the British Museum. ROMAN VILLA: site of,N.W.of Hemsworth Farm.There were four mosaic pavements and a hypercaust indicating five rectangular rooms. The largest mosaic was thirteen foot square and contained a circular panel it is now in Dorchester Museum together with a plunge bath which has a petta pattern on its floor.Also found at Hemsworth were several pavements, one now in the British Museum has a central panel, in white, of Venus rising naked from the waves backed by a shell of red, grey and white.Boarded floors were also found though there is evidence of destruction by fire.Amongstthe finds were coins of Tetricus I,Constantine I and Gratian.
